_comments.autoOverwrite: Automatically overwrite existing output files without prompting. When false, user will be prompted for each file.
_comments.noXSL: Skip XSLT transformation step. When true, only XML output is generated (no HTML via XSLT).
_comments.noPicoCSS: Disable PicoCSS styling in HTML/XHTML output. PicoCSS is enabled by default for better visual presentation.
_comments.xslFile: Path to custom XSLT file for transformation. Empty string uses default.xsl in current directory.
_comments.outputDir: Directory where output files will be written. Empty string writes to same directory as input files.
_comments.inputFolders: Array of folder paths to process. Can specify multiple folders for batch processing.
_comments.extractArchives: Extract compressed archives (.zip, .tar, .tar.gz, .tgz) before processing. Archives are extracted sequentially.
_comments.maxFileSize: Maximum file size in bytes allowed for processing. Default is 10485760 (10MB). Files exceeding this limit will be skipped.
_comments.maxArchiveSize: Maximum archive size in bytes allowed for extraction. Default is 10485760 (10MB). Archives exceeding this limit will be rejected.
_comments.maxFileCount: Maximum number of files allowed per batch operation. Default is 10000. Batches exceeding this limit will be rejected.
_comments.maxWorkers: Maximum number of concurrent worker goroutines for parallel processing. 0 (default) uses runtime.GOMAXPROCS(0) to auto-detect CPU count.
_comments.parallelThreshold: Minimum number of files required to enable parallel processing. Default is 2. Fewer files will be processed sequentially.
_comments.noParallel: Force sequential processing even when parallelization would be beneficial. Overrides parallelThreshold setting.
_comments.dryRun: Preview mode: scan files and validate limits without actually processing or generating output files.
_comments.validateOnly: Validation mode: parse files to check for errors but do not generate output files. Useful for checking file integrity.
_comments.preserveStructure: Maintain directory structure in output. When true, output mirrors input directory hierarchy. When false, all files are flattened into output directory.
_comments.logging: Logging configuration object. See logging.* fields below.
_comments.logging.level: Minimum log level: 'debug', 'info', 'warn', 'error', or 'fatal'. Default is 'info'.
_comments.logging.file.enabled: Enable file logging. Default is false.
_comments.logging.file.path: Directory for log files. Default is './logs'.
_comments.logging.file.filename: Base filename for logs. Default is 'adc.log'.
_comments.logging.file.maxSize: Maximum file size in bytes before rotation. Default is 10485760 (10MB).
_comments.logging.file.maxFiles: Number of old log files to keep. Default is 5.
_comments.logging.console.enabled: Enable console logging. Default is true.
_comments.logging.console.level: Minimum console log level (can differ from file level). Default matches logging.level.
